parameters.text:
=Full Call Transcript:
{{ $json['Full call Transcript'] }}


Business Context:
Context 4: Business Overview
Ancient Remedies is a direct response e-commerce brand that produces natural health books and guides, primarily targeting the 40+ market. Our products focus on helping people get healthier at home using everyday ingredients—teaching simple, natural approaches to self-care and wellness without relying on anything special or exotic. We acquire approximately 30,000 new customers each month, with sales split roughly 50/50 between the U.S. and international markets, with 85% of sales coming from the Big 5 (US, UK, CA, AU, NZ). Our advertising is primarily through Facebook and YouTube, using video ads that lead to an advertorial, followed by a sales page, checkout, and post-purchase upsells. While we initially relied on 30-minute video sales letters, we’ve since shifted toward short-form video content, including shorter VSLs and video shorts, which now drive the bulk of our performance.
General Shipping Info:
For US/UK/AU/CA - ships from local warehouse in 3-5 business days
Rest of world - 7-10 days
Tracked and insured shipping
60 day money back guarantee on all products.


Our Vision:
Our vision is to create the world’s most accessible, scientifically backed, beautifully designed, and easy-to-use natural health products—empowering people everywhere to take charge of their well-being from the comfort of their own homes. We believe that true health doesn’t require expensive treatments or exotic ingredients; it begins with knowledge, intention, and the simple things already in your kitchen. By making timeless wisdom practical and actionable, we aim to become a global force for good—improving lives at scale through: better health, more vitality, and greater self-reliance for millions around the world.

Context 5: Org Chart 
(rev 13 July 2025)
Remote-first, Texas-registered (LLC ➜ S-Corp). Team hubs: Philippines (70%), rest distributed primarily across Asia, with a few in Europe
~47 full time contractors as of Aug 22



Partners / Leadership

 • Owns product development, creatives, engineering, overall vision

 • Owns conversion/CRO and physical supply chain


Zain – Co-founder

 • Owns operations, channel expansion, affiliate & organic programs

 • Team: 8/9 video editors under Shai

UGC / Affiliate / Organic

Engineering
Owner: Kamal (Head of Engineering)

Conversion / Funnel CRO
Owner: Jack

Fulfilment & Operations

G&A

Tax & compliance: new external tax team onboarding

External Agencies / Vendors

Email agency – Harris (primary contact)

Context 6: Audience Overview
Ancient Remedies customers—largely health-conscious, skeptical of mainstream medicine, and strongly motivated by either serious chronic ailments or a desire to live more “naturally”—respond best to well-structured, easy-to-implement guides and references. Focus on condition-specific solutions, practical how-to steps, and real synergy-based remedies.

Demographics & Life Stage
Age Range: Primarily 45–75. Many are retirees or approaching retirement and want to preserve/improve health.
Gender: Both men and women, but there is a slight lean toward women (often the household caretaker or family health “researcher”).
Location: Predominantly the U.S., Canada, UK, Australia, and New Zealand—but with scattered international buyers (sell in 130+ countries). 
Lifestyle:
A mix of suburban, rural, and small homesteads. Many have gardens (or want to start one).
Some are “preppers” or folks wanting self-sufficiency in uncertain times.
Others are simply trying to age gracefully and avoid heavy reliance on doctors.
Psychographics & Beliefs
Strong Distrust of Big Pharma: They feel over-prescribed or neglected by modern medicine. Many have experienced frustration with doctors pushing medications rather than root-cause solutions.
Desire to Return to ‘Nature’s Pharmacy’: They believe real healing often comes from plants, herbs, and ancestral wisdom, not labs.
DIY and Self-Reliant Mindset: They want practical, hands-on knowledge they can apply at home—especially if finances or healthcare availability is limited.
Family-Centric: A good portion want to help their spouse, children, grandchildren, or elderly parents. They see “healthy living” as a gift to pass down.
Concerned About Aging Well: Many mention fear of mental decline (memory, dementia), joint pain, inflammation, arthritis, diabetes, heart issues, or kidney problems.
Value High-Quality Learning Materials: Physical, easy-to-reference guides are key. They’re sick of half-baked internet info and value a trusted “one-stop-shop” resource.
2. Biggest Pain Points and Challenges
1) Chronic Conditions & Inflammation
Diabetes (type 2 especially) is top of mind.
High blood pressure, high cholesterol.
Autoimmune disorders (arthritis, fibromyalgia, hypothyroidism, etc.).
Kidney disease (many at stage 3 or above, worried about dialysis).
Inflammatory issues: joint pain, gout, scleroderma, etc.
2) Disillusionment with Conventional Medicine
Feeling “stuck” on multiple prescriptions with side effects.
Distrust after seeing repeated “band-aid fixes” that do not address the root cause.
Negative experiences with doctors, hospitals, or a family member’s poor outcome.
3) “Getting Older” Concerns
Reduced mobility, fatigue, and fear of cognitive decline.
Menopause / hormone imbalances, hair loss, declining vitality.
Weight gain and struggles with diets that never last.
4) Accessibility & Ease of Use
They want clarity on dosages (which many herbal books fail to provide).
Step-by-step instructions (how to brew, how to make tinctures, balms, teas).
Quick references. They love the laminated card format, bullet points, and pictures.
5) Financial / Budget Pressures
Many on fixed incomes or Social Security.
They worry about paying for medications, so they seek cheaper and more “natural” ways.
International customers are also wary of currency conversion rates and shipping costs.

Context 7: Products Overview

1. Ancient Remedies Revived (ARR)
Price / Format: $37, full-color paperback or embossed hardcover (288 pp).

Core value: Big, “encyclopedia” style reference—250+ herb profiles, synergy recipes, disease index.

Take-away for dev: Customers loved the depth and pretty visuals but found it heavy to use in the kitchen; asked for quicker, condition-specific guidance. ARR proved the appetite for physical, premium design.

2. Recipe Cards (6-card bundle)
Price / Format: $29.99 laminated, wipe-clean kitchen cards.
Core value: “Quick-grab” recipes & herb synergies for six top concerns (Memory, Heart, Blood Sugar, Kidney, Breathing, Mobility).

Dev lesson: Portability + waterproof format solved ARR’s usability pain. Positive feedback on niche-specific cards → guided us toward modular products.

3. Natural Healing Handbook (NHH) – current flagship, ~90 % of revenue
Price / Format: $37 spiral-bound hardcover (80 pp).

Core value: Condenses ARR wisdom into 120+ step-by-step remedies across 15 health categories; easy lay-flat design.

Dev lesson: Customers want actionable shortcuts over encyclopedic detail. The spiral format and recipe-first layout became our new template.

4. Condition Recipe Guides (5 SKUs)
Price / Format: $29.99 leather-bound, 12 pp each.

Topics: Joint Pain, Blood Sugar, Digestion, Brain, Heart.

Core value: Ultra-condensed herb lists + 10 quick recipes per sheet for sufferers who need one focus area.

Dev lesson: Micro-products convert well as upsells; reinforce desire for targeted, visually appealing references.

Upcoming (next 60 days)
Kids’ herbal picture book (ages 5-7)


14-day Liver Detox guide


“Nature’s Kitchen” stand-up flipbook (countertop recipes)


Freemium AI health-advice app (MVP)
+ more



What this tells us about the customer journey
Physical-first, reference-style formats convert best (books → cards → cheat-sheets).


Ease & specificity trump exhaustive detail—hence the move from ARR → NHH → cheat-sheets.


Design & durability (laminated, spiral, leather) are value levers customers happily pay for.


Each new SKU should either:

Solve a narrower health pain in seconds or

Make existing info faster to access (format innovation).

Context 8: Distilled Creative Learnings
Core Patterns in Winning Ads
Strong Hooks Matter Most: The top-performing ads immediately call out a specific pain point (e.g., digestion, blood sugar, forgetfulness) in a natural, unscripted tone.

Recipe-led Value: Audiences love simple, actionable recipes that appear in the book, especially when they:

Use basic kitchen ingredients

Include synergy explanations or basic science/stats for credibility

Tie back clearly to solving a problem

Authenticity Beats Polish:

Filler words (“um”, “like”) enhance relatability

Neutral or calm delivery outperforms overly emotional styles

Simple captioning (white/yellow, no emojis) fits low-production UGC best

Effective Structure Template:

Problem/Pain Point Hook

Present easy recipe/solution

Personal anecdote/testimonial

Show other book contents briefly

Soft but clear CTA (e.g., “It’s on sale, came in 5 days”)

options.systemMessage:
=You are an advanced research agent for writing a step-by-step guide to solve the task if its complicated and need advanced reseach.

You will need the following:
1. action point (to do task).
    for this you can use the tool "Get To dos in Airtables" for searching and loading the tasks.
    there are two tables: 1. To DO List (Me) 2. To Do List (Others).
2. call transcript (for context given as input as a Full Call Transcript).
3. past calls condensed summary:
    for this you can use the tool "Get Summaries in Airtables" for searching and loading the full summaries of the previous calls that belongs to that same call Name in specific table.
    Table Name is: "{{ $json['Table Name'] }}", Meeting Title: "{{ $json['Meeting Title'] }}"

4. business context (given as input).
5. recording url: {{ $json['Recording URL'] }} (This will be used to extract specific data from tables).

Rules:
Take all the action points and only do advanced research for those tasks that you can do advanced research on them.

Compiles results, synthesizes short response

Then recommend people to reach out to, to action on things, with pre-crafted message

If the Tasks is from table: "To DO List (Me)" then in "pre-crafted message" it should be started like: **To be sent to Kamal**

return the output in a list of structured JSON format for each task.

parameters.filterByFormula: ={{ /*n8n-auto-generated-fromAI-override*/ $fromAI('Filter_By_Formula', `filter column "Call Link" by given recording url. to get specific tasks.`, 'string') }}
={{ /*n8n-auto-generated-fromAI-override*/ $fromAI('Filter_By_Formula', `filter column "Call Name" by given Meeting Title. to get specific Full Summaries.`, 'string') }}

parameters.content:
## Advanced Research Agent
### This Agent will do the Advanced Research for each action point (task) that it think it need research.
### Currently only utilizing Gemini.

options.systemMessage:
=use the tools and search for the user input task and return the Monday.com id of the task and name of the table in which this task was found.

You will need the following:
1. action point (to do task).
    for this you can use the tool "Get To dos in Airtables1" for searching the task.
    there are two tables: 1. To DO List (Me) 2. To Do List (Others).

2. Task description should be return as it is.

3. also return "next steps" inputs as it is.

=The user input will be "task description", "update text" to update on Monday.com item.

your tasks are the following:
1. first load all the items by using this tool "Get many items in Monday.com", this will contain many fields and its id use the specific id to add update.

2. Use this "Update Status (Me)" tool to add an update to monday.com group item.
